titles.title: Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael (fols. 3r-95v) I–1) Homily by Timothy (Dämatewos) of Alexandria for the 12th day of Ḫǝdar (fols. 3ra-9ra l.3); two miracles (fols. 9ra l.4-10rb l.1); commemorative notice (fols. 10rb l.2-11vb l.18) I–2) Anonymous homily for the 12th day of Taḫśaś (fols. 11vb l.19-16vb); miracle (fol. 17ra-vb l.5); commemorative notice (fols. 17vb l.6-18va l.3) I–3) Anonymous homily for the 12th day of Ṭǝrr (fols. 18va l.4-27ra l.5); miracle (fols. 27ra l.6-28vb l.17); commemorative notice (fols. 27vb l.18-28ra l.11) I–4) Anonymous homily for the 12th day of Yäkkatit (fols. 28ra l.12-31ra l.13); miracle (fols. 31ra l.14-32ra l.2); commemorative notice (fol. 32ra l.3-vb l.2) I–5) Homily by Patriarch John of Antiochia for the 12th day of Mäggabit (fols. 32vb l.3-46rb l.17); miracle (fols. 46rb l.18-49vb l.2); commemorative notice (fols. 49vb l.3-50ra l.8) I–6) [Homily by John the Orthodox for the 12th of Miyazya] (fols. 50ra l.9-54rb), miracle (fols. 54va-56vb l.5); commemorative notice (fols. 56vb l.6-57rb l.5) I–7) Homily by Yoḥannǝs, Metropolitan of Ethiopia for the 12th of Gǝnbot (fols. 57rb l.6-59ra l.5); miracle (fols. 59ra l.6-61ra l.12); commemorative notice (fol. 61ra l.13-vb l.10) I–8) Homily by Yoḥannǝs, Metropolitan of Aksum for the 12th day of Säne (fols. 61vb l.11-74va l.11); miracle (fol. 74va l.4-vb l.2); commemorative notice (fols. 74vb l.3-76ra l.2) I–9) Homily of Bishop John for the 12th day of Ḥamle (fols. 76ra l.3-80ra l.3); miracle (fol. 80ra l.3-vb l.8); commemorative notice (fols. 80vb l.9-81rb l.15) I–10) Homily by an anonymous author for the 12th day of Näḥase (fols. 81rb l.16-84ra l.13); miracle (fol. 84ra l.14-vb l.12); commemorative notice (fols. 84vb l.13-85ra l.1) I–11) Anonymous homily for the 12th day of Mäskäräm (fols. 85ra l.1-87va l.14); miracle (fols. 87va l.15-89va l.14); commemorative notice (fol. 89va l.15-vb) I–12) Anonymous homily for the 12th day of Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 90ra-93rb l.5); miracle (fols. 93rb l.6-94vb l.9); commemorative notice (fols. 94vb l.10-95vb)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: The donor, Wäldä Maryam, is mentioned in Additio 1 and in the supplication formulas. His father, Gäbrä Wahǝd, and his mother, Wälättä ʾAnanya, are also mentioned. Other names appear in the supplication formulas, such as Fǝśśǝḥa Giyorgis (e.g., fols. 17ra, 31ra), Gäbrä ʾIyäsus (fol. 28ra), Wälättä Śǝllase (fols. 28ra, 59ra).

txstates.txstate: Both wooden boards are broken and repaired with two different types of threads. The cover is partly torn off (esp. from the front board; 70 % is left); a tear on the spine cover is repaired. Holes amended on fols. 1, 57, 90.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (both broken and repaired) covered with reddish brown tooled leather which is partly torn off; a paper print with devotional image of St. Michael (partly torn off) serves as an inlay; black textile is used for an inlay on the back board. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish brown leather cover (at least four tools were used: triple line fillet, small x, double circle, x-form).

bnothers.bnother: One pair of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

txfolios.txfolio: Number 49 has been skipped in foliation.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – ፩I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – ፪II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 35r-42v) – VI(8/fols. 43r-51v) – ፯VII(8; s.l. 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 52r-59v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 60r-67v) – IX(8/fols. 68r-75v) – X(8/fols. 76r-83v) – ፲፩X(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 8; 8, stub after 3/fols. 84r-93v) – XII(3; s.l.: 3 stub before 1/fols. 94r-96v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The quality of the handwriting deteriorates esp. on fols. 33v-34r, 79r.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the donor and his family members (the whole name or the second component); 1st, 2nd, 5th 6th, 17th and 18th line on the incipit page; two initial lines of the sub-sections; names of the months on fols. 76r, 81rb; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of the chapter dividers (e.g., fol. 32va); elements of Ethiopic numerals.

additional.det: The note is written in the main hand. It contains the names of the donor Wäldä Maryam, as well as his father Gäbrä Wahǝd, his mother Wälättä ʾAnanya and the older variant of the church name, i.e., Qärnä Säbär.

extras.extra: - The names of the donors and nomina sacra are sometimes written in the supplication formulas, in a secondary hand: fols. 17vb, 22rab, 28ra, 31ra, 32ra, 78rb). - Writing exercises and doodles: fols. 1r, 11v, 12r, 25v, 39v, 46v, 47r, 61r, 84r, 96rv.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months written, with decoration, in the upper margin of fols: 3r, 11vb, 18va, 32ra (in pen), 57rb, 61vb, 81rb, 85rb, 90r.
